Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cluck \Cluck\, n. 1. The call of a hen to her chickens. [1913 Webster]
2. A click. See 3d {Click}, 2. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Cluck \Cluck\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Clucked}; p pr. & vb. n. {Clucking}.] [AS. cloccian; cf. D. klokken, G. glucken, glucksen, LG. klukken, Dan. klukke; all prob. of imitative origin.] To make the noise, or utter the call, of a brooding hen. --Ray. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Cluck \Cluck\, v. t. To call together, or call to follow, as a hen does her chickens. [1913 Webster]
She, poor hen, fond of no second brood, Has clucked three to the wars. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
cluck n : the sound made by a hen (as in calling her chicks) v : make a clucking sounds, characteristic of hens [syn: {click}, {clack}]
